name: Canvas Component Create

movements.name: Create

beats.title: Resolve Template
beats.userStory: As a platform reliability engineer, I need `resolveTemplate` to deterministically resolve component schemas and bindings within 1s P95 (99.9% success), deduping remote fetches and emitting telemetry so downstream renderers can build pages without retries.
beats.testCase: dedupes schema fetches across multiple calls and instances

then: it performs its expected orchestration logic
and: emits expected side effects or returns expected value

beats.title: Register Instance
beats.userStory: As a frontend platform integrator, I need `registerInstance` to assign stable IDs and semantic classes to imported components within 1s P95 and persist registration events so style hooks and analytics can target instances consistently across sessions.
beats.testCase: adds rx-comp-<tag>-<id> class for imported components

then: it performs its expected orchestration logic
and: emits expected side effects or returns expected value

beats.title: Create Node
beats.userStory: As a page composition service, I need `createNode` to assemble a canvas node from resolved templates within 2s P95 without directly rendering React, forwarding to the drop symphony and validating schema to keep the composition pipeline decoupled and safe.
beats.testCase: forwards to drop symphony and does not render React nodes directly

then: it performs its expected orchestration logic
and: emits expected side effects or returns expected value

beats.title: Render React Component
beats.userStory: As a UI runtime engineer, I need `renderReact` to instantiate React components from composed nodes in <200ms P95, with memoized props and keyed lists, emitting perf telemetry so UI remains responsive on median devices.
beats.testCase: creates a React component through the complete create sequence

then: it performs its expected orchestration logic
and: emits expected side effects or returns expected value

beats.scenario: Publish UI State Change Notifications to Event System
beats.userStory: As an event-driven UI orchestrator, I need UI class/state changes published with <20ms end-to-end delivery, ordered FIFO with backpressure, so subscribers (controls, analytics, accessibility) react consistently without missed transitions.

and: emits expected side effects or returns expected value
